body:
Works:

```
gmt begin distance

cat<<eof > line.gmt
11.8213098427257 59.2981760667549
11.820423005147 59.3049383101702
11.8215291228961 59.3117866973081
11.8181587847801 59.3327127286014
11.8162451512673 59.3447444476663
11.8083504018854 59.3538556194653
11.7898302925765 59.371067915292
11.7897023421498 59.3716407350687
11.7896956870986 59.3717036592871
11.7897238071601 59.3717619580636
eof

# make distance grid
gmt grdmath -I1 -RNO line.gmt LDIST = line-distance.nc

# plot earth relief
gmt grdimage @earth_relief_06m -JM15c -t20

# plot line
gmt plot line.gmt -Wthick,red -l"Line"

# plot contours
gmt grdcontour -C100 -A200 line-distance.nc -Bxaf -Byaf -l"100 km"

# clean up
rm line.gmt

gmt end show
```

Now change `@earth_relief_06m` to `@earth_relief_05m` (i.e. from a single grid file to tiled dataset):

```
gmt begin distance

cat<<eof > line.gmt
11.8213098427257 59.2981760667549
11.820423005147 59.3049383101702
11.8215291228961 59.3117866973081
11.8181587847801 59.3327127286014
11.8162451512673 59.3447444476663
11.8083504018854 59.3538556194653
11.7898302925765 59.371067915292
11.7897023421498 59.3716407350687
11.7896956870986 59.3717036592871
11.7897238071601 59.3717619580636
eof

# make distance grid
gmt grdmath -I1 -RNO line.gmt LDIST = line-distance.nc

# plot earth relief
gmt grdimage @earth_relief_05m -JM15c -t20

# plot line
gmt plot line.gmt -Wthick,red -l"Line"

# plot contours
gmt grdcontour -C100 -A200 line-distance.nc -Bxaf -Byaf -l"100 km"

# clean up
rm line.gmt

gmt end show
```

and the blending has a problem:

```
[...]
grdblend [ERROR]: Offending option -R0/-0/0/-0
[...]
```

Add `-RNO` to the `grdimage` command and it works.
title: Problem passing -R when using a tiled dataset
